ac.special: 10 + 2 (Quadraped only) + half of this spell's level rounded up

hp.special: 2 + 2 per spell level (the familiar has a number of Hit Dice [d4s] equal to the spell's level)

trait.name: Adaptive (Fish Only)
entries: The familiar can breathe air and water. You can choose to make it so it cannot breathe air. If you do, it has one tolerance to one damage type of your choice.

trait.name: Miniscule (Insect Only)
entries: Decrease the familiar's size by 1.

trait.name: Enhanced Abilities
entries: Whenever the otherworldly familiar makes a dexterity or wisdom ability check or saving throw, it can add half the spell's level rounded down.

action.name: Otherworldly Scratch
entries: {@atk m} Bonus equal your Spell Attack Modifier, reach 5 ft. {@h}1 + the spell's level of Radiant (Celestial), Psychic (Fey), or Necrotic (Fiend) damage.

reaction.name: Deliver Spell
entries: When you cast a spell with a range of touch, the familiar can deliver the spell with its touch. To do so, the familiar must be within 120 feet of you.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atkr m} {@hitYourSpellAttack Bonus equals your spell attack modifier}, reach 5 ft. {@h}Force damage equal to {@damage 1d4 - 3} + your spellcasting ability modifier (Medium or smaller), {@damage 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier (Large), or {@damage 2d12 + 3} + your spellcasting ability modifier (Huge).

ac.special: 10 + 1 half of this spell's level rounded down

hp.special: 2 + 4 per spell level (the steed has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to the spell's level)

trait.name: Ability Growth
entries: Whenever the otherworldly Steed makes a strength or constitution ability check or saving throw, it can add half the spell's level rounded down.

trait.name: Adaptive (Water Only)
entries: The Steed can breathe air and water. You can choose to make it so it cannot breathe air. If you do, it has one tolerance to one damage type of your choice.

action.name: Otherworldly Maul
entries: {@atk m} Bonus equals half your spell attack modifier, reach 5 ft. {@h} 1 + twice the spell's level of Radiant (Celestial), Psychic (Fey), or Necrotic (Fiend) damage.

spell.name: Poison Spray
entries: You spray toxic mist at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} Poison damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d12}), 11 ({@damage 3d12}), and 17 ({@damage 4d12}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Prestidigitation
entries: You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

entries.name: Sensory Effect
entries: You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

entries.name: Fire Play
entries: You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

entries.name: Clean or Soil
entries: You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

entries.name: Minor Sensation
entries: You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

entries.name: Magic Mark
entries: You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

entries.name: Minor Creation
entries: You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Purify Food and Drink
entries: You remove poison, rot, and acids from food and drink in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. The poison or acid cannot be worth more than 5gp.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, multiply the worth of the poison or acid that can be removed by 3 for each additional level.

spell.name: Fear
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot Cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for the duration.

A {@condition Frightened|XPHB} creature takes the {@action Dash|XPHB} action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. At the end of each of its turns it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Polymorph
entries: You attempt to transform a creature that you can see within range into a Beast. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or shape-shift into Beast form for the duration. At the start of each of their turns the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success.

When you prepare this spell, choose 3 stat blocks with the beast creature type that have a CR equal to or less than twice this spell's level plus your spellcasting modifier. Choose one of these beasts to transform the target into. The target's game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the Beast, but the target retains its alignment, personality, creature type, saving throw modifiers, {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, and {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}. You can prepare this spell multiple times, but you must pick different stat blocks each time.

The target gains a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} of the Beast form. The spell ends early on the target if it has no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} left. It looses these temporary hit points if the spell ends.
The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form, and it can't speak or cast spells.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't use or otherwise benefit from any of that equipment.

spell.name: True Polymorph

components.m: a drop of mercury, a dollop of gum arabic, and a wisp of smoke

entries: Choose one creature or nonmagical object that you can see within range. The creature shape-shifts into a different creature or a nonmagical object, or the object shape-shifts into a creature (the object must be neither worn nor carried). The transformation lasts for the duration or until the target dies or is destroyed, but if you maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on this spell for the full duration, the spell lasts until dispelled.

When you prepare this spell, choose 5 stat blocks with a challenge rating of 18 + your spellcasting modifier or lower. You can prepare this spell multiple times, but you must pick different stat blocks each time.

An unwilling creature that is being targeted or is holding the item being targeted can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, the spell has no effect. This spell has no effect on items worth 100,000gp or more.

entries.name: Creature into Creature
entries: If you turn a creature into another kind of creature, choose one of the prepared stat blocks to turn it into. The target's game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the new form, but it retains its saving throw modifiers, {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}, alignment, and personality.

The target gains a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} of the new form. The spell ends early on the target if it has no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} left. It looses these temporary hit points if the spell ends.
The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form, and it can't speak or cast spells.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't use or otherwise benefit from any of that equipment.

entries.name: Object into Creature
entries: If you turn an object into a creature, choose one of the prepared stat blocks to turn it into. The stat block's creature size must be no larger than the object's size. The creature is Friendly to you and your allies. In combat, it takes its turns immediately after yours, and it obeys your commands.
If the spell lasts more than an hour, you no longer control the creature. It might remain Friendly to you, depending on how you have treated it.

entries.name: Creature into Object
entries: If you turn a creature into an object, it transforms along with whatever it is wearing and carrying into that form, as long as the object's size is no larger than the creature's size. The creature's statistics become those of the object, and the creature has no memory of time spent in this form after the spell ends and it returns to normal. The object must not be worth more than 500gp and it cannot be expended while the change is not permanent.

spell.name: Mass Polymorph
entries: You attempt to transform up to 10 creatures that you can see within range into Beasts. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or shape-shift into Beast form for the duration. At the start of each of their turns the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on them on a success.

When you prepare this spell, choose 5 stat blocks with the beast creature type that have a CR equal to or less than 18 plus your spellcasting modifier. Choose one of these stat blocks to transform each target into, and you can choose the same form or different ones for each target. The target's game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the Beast, but the target retains its alignment, personality, creature type, saving throw modifiers, Hit Points, and Hit Point Dice. You can prepare this spell multiple times, but you must pick different stat blocks each time.

Each target gains a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the Beast form. The spell stops affecting the target if it has no Temporary Hit Points left. It looses these temporary hit points if the spell ends.
The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form, and it can't speak or cast spells.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't use or otherwise benefit from any of that equipment.

spell.name: Prismatic Wall
entries: A shimmering, multicolored plane of light forms a vertical opaque wall—up to 90 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 inch thick—centered on a point within range. Alternatively, you shape the wall into a globe up to 30 feet in diameter centered on a point within range. The wall lasts for the duration. If you position the wall in a space occupied by a creature, the spell ends instantly without effect.

The wall sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} within 100 feet and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 100 feet. You and creatures you designate when you cast the spell can pass through and be near the wall without harm. Whenever another creature that can see the wall moves is within 20 feet of it, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. After a creature makes this saving throw it does not need to do so again until the start of its next turn.

The wall consists of seven layers, each with a different color. When a creature reaches into or passes through the wall, it does so one layer at a time through all the layers. Each layer forces the creature to make a Dexterity saving throw or be affected by that layer's properties as described in the Prismatic Layers table. After a creature makes a saving throw for a layer, it does not need to make a saving throw for that layer again until the start of its next turn.

The wall, which has AC 10, can be destroyed one layer at a time, in order from red to violet, by means specific to each layer. If a layer is destroyed, it is gone for the duration. {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB} has no effect on the wall, and {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} can affect only the violet layer.

entries.caption: Prismatic Layers
rows: {@b Red.} {@i Failed Save:} {@damage 12d6} Fire damage. {@i Successful Save:} Half as much damage. {@i Additional Effects}: Nonmagical ranged attacks can't pass through this layer, which is destroyed if it takes at least 25 Cold damage.

{@b Orange.} {@i Failed Save:} {@damage 12d6} Acid damage. {@i Successful Save:} Half as much damage. {@i Additional Effects:} Magical ranged attacks can't pass through this layer, which is destroyed by a strong wind (such as the one created by {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB}).
{@b Yellow.} {@i Failed Save:} {@damage 12d6} Lightning damage. {@i Successful Save:} Half as much damage. {@i Additional Effects:} The layer is destroyed if it takes at least 60 Force damage.

{@b Green.} {@i Failed Save:} {@damage 12d6} Poison damage. {@i Successful Save:} Half as much damage. {@i Additional Effects:} A {@spell Passwall|XPHB} spell, or another spell of equal or greater level that can open a portal on a solid surface, destroys this layer.
{@b Blue.} {@i Failed Save:} {@damage 12d6} Cold damage. {@i Successful Save:} Half as much damage. {@i Additional Effects:} The layer is destroyed if it takes at least 25 Fire damage.

{@b Indigo.} {@i Failed Save:} The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the condition ends. If it fails three times, it has the {@condition Petrified|XPHB} condition until it is freed by an effect like the {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} spell. The successes and failures needn't be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind. {@i Additional Effects:} Spells can't be cast through this layer, which is destroyed by {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} shed by the {@spell Daylight|XPHB} spell.

{@b Violet.} {@i Failed Save:} The target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition and makes a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the condition ends. On a failed save, the condition ends, and the creature teleports to another plane of existence (DM's choice). {@i Additional Effects:} This layer is destroyed by {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}.

spell.name: Revivify

m.text: a diamond worth 300+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has been dead for no longer than a minute. It must make a DC 10 death saving throw.

On a success, the creature is revived with 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}. If its also a natural 20, the spell does not consume its material component. On a failure, this spell cannot be used to revive this creature. This restriction ends if the creature is revived through other means. If its also a natural 1, the creature can never be revived.
This spell can't revive a creature that has died of old age, nor does it restore any missing body parts.

spell.name: Raise Dead

m.text: a diamond worth 500+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has been dead for no longer than 10 days and wasn't Undead when it died. It must make a DC 10 death saving throw.

On a success, it is revived with 1 Hit Point. If its also a natural 20, the spell does not consume its material component. On a failure, this spell cannot be used to revive this creature. This restriction ends if the creature is revived through other means. If its also a natural 1, it can never be revived.

Any poisons that affected the revived creature at its time of death are neutralized. All mortal wounds on the revived creature are closed, but it doesn't restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell has no effect.
Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The revived creature takes 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Resurrection

m.text: a diamond worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has has been dead for no longer than a century, didn't die of old age, and wasn't Undead when it died. It must make a DC 10 death saving throw.

On a success, it is revived with all of its Hit Points. If its also a natural 20, the spell does not consume its material component. On a failure, this spell cannot be used to revive this creature. This restriction ends if the creature is revived through other means. If its also a natural 1, it can never be revived.
Any poisons that affected the creature at its time of death are neutralized. All mortal wounds on the revived creature are closed and any of the revived creature's missing body parts are restored.
Any poisons that affected the revived creature at its time of death are neutralized. All mortal wounds on the revived creature close and any missing body parts are restored.
Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The revived creature takes 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

Successfully reviving a creature that has been dead for 365 days or longer taxes you. Until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can't cast spells again, and you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.

spell.name: True Resurrection

m.text: diamonds worth 25,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature that has been dead for no longer than 2 centuries and that died for any reason except old age. It must make a DC 10 death saving throw.

On a success, the creature is revived with all of its Hit Point. If its also a natural 20, the spell does not consume its material component. On a failure, this spell cannot be used to revive this creature. This restriction ends if the creature is revived through other means. If its also a natural 1, the creature can never be revived.

This spell closes all wounds, neutralizes any poison, cures all magical contagions, and lifts any curses affecting the revived creature when it died. The spell replaces the revived creature's damaged or missing organs and limbs. If the revived creature was Undead, it is restored to its non-Undead form.

The spell can provide a new body for the revived creature if the original no longer exists, in which case you must speak the creature's name. It appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 10 feet of you.

spell.name: Rope Trick
entries: You touch a rope. One end of it hovers upward until the rope hangs perpendicular to the ground or the rope reaches a ceiling. At the rope's upper end, an {@condition Invisible|XPHB} 3-foot-by-5-foot portal opens to an extradimensional space that lasts until the spell ends. That space can be reached by climbing the rope As an action, the roped can be pulled into or dropped out of that space.

The space can hold up to eight Medium or smaller creatures. Attacks, spells, and other effects can't pass into or out of the space, but creatures inside it can see through the portal. Anything inside the space drops out when the spell ends.

spell.name: See Invisibility
entries: For the duration, a creature you can see within 30 ft can see creatures and objects that have the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of creatures you can choose increases by 1 for each spell slot above 3

spell.name: Shape Water
entries: You choose an area of water that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

items: You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the water as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn't have enough force to cause damage. Until the end of your next turn the water is held aloft as long as it is not holding anything else aloft.
You cause the water to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You change the water's color or opacity. The water must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You freeze the water, provided that there are no creatures in it. The water unfreezes in 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Shillelagh
entries: A Club, Greatclub, Warclub, Staff or Quarterstaff you are holding is imbued with nature's power. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon.
The spell ends early if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.

spell.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: Lightning springs from you to a creature that you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Lightning damage, and it can't make Opportunity Attacks until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d10}), 11 ({@damage 3d10}), and 17 ({@damage 4d10}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Spare the Dying
entries: You take the help action to attempt to stabilize a creature in range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The range doubles when you reach levels 5 (30 feet), 11 (60 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

spell.name: Spike Growth
entries: The ground in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 2d4} Piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area when the spell is cast must take a {@action Search|XPHB} action and succeed on a Wisdom ({@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival}) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

spell.name: Spirit Guardians
entries: Protective spirits flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. Choose necrotic or radiant damage when you prepare this spell. You can prepare this spell multiple times as long as you pick a different damage type each time.

Enemies treat the affected area as difficult terrain and must make a wisdom saving throw when they are within it. On a failed save, they take {@dice 2d6} of the chosen damage type. On a success, they take half as much. Once they make the saving throw they do not need to do so again until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d8|3-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Thorn Whip

components.m: the stem of a plant with thorns

entries: You create a vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Piercing damage, and if it is Large or smaller, you can pull it up to 10 feet closer to you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Vicious Mockery
entries: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature you can see or hear within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} Psychic damage and have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes that does not already have disadvantage before the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6}).

spell.name: Wall of Force
entries: An {@condition Invisible|XPHB} wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a globe with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick and lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (you choose which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It has an AC of 5 and 120 hit points. It can't be dispelled by {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB}. A {@spell Disintegrate|XPHB} spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane and blocks ethereal travel through the wall.

spell.name: Word of Recall
entries: You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.
You must designate a location, such as a temple, as a sanctuary by casting this spell there.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Shapechange
entries: You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} no higher than your level or {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB}. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can't be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} of the form. The spell ends early if you have no {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}; {@variantrule Hit Point Dice|XPHB}; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too. You do not gain any traits of the new form that allow for casting spells or changing shape.
Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you're in it.

spell.name: Simulacrum

m.text: powdered ruby worth 1,500+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You force a Beast or Humanoid that is within 10 feet of you for the entire casting of the spell to make a wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you create a simulacrum of them. You finish the casting by touching both the creature and a pile of ice or snow that is the same size as that creature. That pile turns into the simulacrum, which is a creature. It uses the game statistics of the original creature at the time of casting, except it is a Construct, its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum is half as much, it can't cast spells and it can't change shape.
The simulacrum is Friendly to you and creatures you designate. It obeys your commands. The simulacrum can't gain levels, and it can't take Short or Long Rests.

If the simulacrum takes damage, the only way to restore its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} is to repair it as you take a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, during which you expend components worth 100 GP per {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} restored. The simulacrum must stay within 5 feet of you for the repair.

The simulacrum lasts until it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, at which point it reverts to snow and melts away. If you cast this spell again, any simulacrum you created with this spell is instantly destroyed.

spell.name: Control Flames
entries: You choose nonmagical flame that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You affect it in one of the following ways:

items: You instantaneously create a new flame within 5 ft of it that fits within a 5-foot cube. Until the end of your next turn the new flame persists without fuel.
You instantaneously extinguish the flames within the cube.
You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the flame, change its color, or both. The change lasts for 1 hour.
You cause simple shapes—such as the vague form of a creature, an inanimate object, or a location—to appear within the flames and animate as you like. The shapes last for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three non-instantaneous effects created by it active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Gust
entries: You seize the air and compel it to create one of the following effects at a point you can see within range:

items: One Medium or smaller creature that you choose must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from you.

You create a small blast of air capable of moving one object that is neither held nor carried and that weighs no more than 5 pounds. The object is pushed up to 10 feet away from you. It isn't pushed with enough force to cause damage. Until the end of your next turn it is held aloft as long as it is not holding anything else aloft
You create a harmless sensory effect using air, such as causing leaves to rustle, wind to slam shutters closed, or your clothing to ripple in a breeze.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Mold Earth
entries: You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

items: If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn't involve enough force to cause damage. Until the end of your next turn it is held aloft as long as it is not holding anything else aloft.
You create a sculpture out of the stone or dirt that weighs 5 lbs or less and consist of simple shapes. The changes last for 1 hour.

If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. This change lasts for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Remove Curse
entries: At your touch, all curses with a spell level of 3 or less affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the level of curse it can remove by 1 for each additional level.

spell.name: Greater Restoration

m.text: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature and magically remove one of the following effects from it:

items: 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level
The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Petrified|XPHB} condition
A curse with a spell level equal to or less than this spell's level or their attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores
Any reduction to the target's {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximum

spell.name: Anger
entries: Enemies in a 20 ft emanation centered on yourself must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Angered condition for the duration.

Any movement the angered creature takes must be towards the source of its anger and it must take the attack action. Attack Rolls against the angered creature have advantage. If it deals damage it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. Once it repeats the saving throw it cannot do so again until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Anchorbind

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 20 ft attempts to move away from you

entries: The target must succeed on a strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 ft straight towards you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level increase the range by 20 and the distance the target can be dragged by 10 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Scapegoat
entries: Choose a willing creature you can see. For the duration any creatures angered, {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} by you treat the target as the source of their anger, their fear or the charm while it is within 10 ft of you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell at a higher level, increase the range by 10 ft for each additional level.

spell.name: Anchor Howl
entries: Once per turn when you make an opportunity attack against a creature that can hear you, you can do so without expending your reaction.

spell.name: Seal Good and Evil
entries: You create a 20ft diameter circle centered on a point you touch. As a bonus action you can force every aberration, fey, fiend, celestial, elemental or undead adjacent to or overlapping the circle to make a charisma saving throw. If it fails three times in a row, it is imprisoned in a harmless demiplane. While imprisoned, the target doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Divination spells can't locate or perceive the imprisoned target, and the target can't teleport. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, you no longer need to concentrate on it, you can no longer use your bonus action to activate it and it lasts for a day. When the spell ends, the creatures reappears in an occupied space nearest to the seal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, increase how long the seal lasts after {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on it for the full duration to a week at 6th level, 30 days at 7th level, a year at 8th level or until dispelled at 9th level.

spell.name: Bane
entries: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must each make a Charisma saving throw. Whenever a target that fails this save makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the attack roll or save. Do not add it if a negative bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Banishment
entries: One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or have the {@condition incapacitated} condition for the duration. While {@condition incapacitated} the creature is teleported to a harmless demiplane. Once the target is no longer {@condition incapacitated}, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn't return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM's choice) associated with its creature type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

spell.name: True Strike

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 15 feet would miss an attack roll that has disadvantage

entries: Add a {@dice d4}, potentially turning it into a success. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can cast this once and regain the ability to do so after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The number of d4s increases by 1 at 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}). Only use the highest roll.

spell.name: Guidance

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 10 feet makes an ability check

entries: Add a {@dice d4}. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can forgo such bonuses to benefit from this spell. You can cast this once and regain this ability after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The number of d4s increases by 1 at 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}). Only use the highest roll.

spell.name: Resistance

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature within 10 feet would fail a saving throw

entries: Add a {@dice d4}, potentially turning it into a success. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell. You can forgo such bonuses to benefit from this spell. You can cast this once and regain this ability after a short rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The number of d4s increases by 1 at 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}). Only use the highest {@dice d4} roll.

spell.name: Magic Stone
entries: You touch one to three pebbles and imbue them with magic. You or someone else can make a ranged spell attack with one of the pebbles by throwing it or hurling it with a sling, slingshot or warsling. If thrown, it has a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with the pebble, that attacker adds your spellcasting ability modifier, not the attacker's, to the attack roll. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Hit or miss, the spell then ends on the stone. If you cast this spell again, the spell ends early on any pebbles still affected by it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The attack's damage die changes when you reach levels 5 ({@dice d8}), 11({@dice d10}), and 17 ({@dice d12}).

spell.name: Shield

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch would get hit by an attack roll

entries: The target gains 1 AC against the triggering attack roll. The bonus is not applied if the target's AC is already increased by a spell. The target can forgo such increases in order to benefit from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the bonus by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Absorb Elements

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

entries: Subtract a {@dice d6} from the damage of the triggering damage type that the creature took. Once before the end of their next turn when they hit with a melee attack they may deal additional damage of the same amount and type prevented.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the amount subtracted increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Feather Fall

time.condition: which you take when a creature within 60ft falls

entries: The falling creature makes a dexterity saving throw, which they can choose to fail. If they fail, their rate of descent slows to 30 feet per round until the spell ends. If the creature lands before the spell ends, it takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

components.m: a small feather or piece of down

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can target an additional creature for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Gift of Gab

time.condition: which you take when a creature within 90ft hears you speak

entries: You attempt to skillfully reshape the memories of a listener. The target makes an Intelligence Saving Throw. If they fail, they forget everything you said within the last 6 seconds, including the verbal components of spells, and remember that you actually said the words you speak as the verbal component of this spell. Additionally, it does not notice you performing the somatic components of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can target one additional creature per additional spell level.

spell.name: Soul Cage

time.condition: which you take when a humanoid you can see within 60ft of you dies

entries: This spell snatches the soul of a humanoid as it dies and traps it inside the tiny cage you use for the material component. A stolen soul remains inside the cage until the spell ends or until you destroy the cage, which ends the spell. While you have a soul inside the cage, you can exploit it in any of the ways described below. You can use a trapped soul up to six times. Once you exploit a soul for the sixth time, it is released, and the spell ends. While a soul is trapped, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.
Steal Life. You can use a bonus action to drain vigor from the soul and regain {@dice 2d8} hit points.

Query Soul. You ask the soul a question (no action required) and receive a brief telepathic answer, which you can understand regardless of the language used. The soul knows only what it knew in life, but it must answer you truthfully and to the best of its ability. The answer is no more than a sentence or two and might be cryptic.

Borrow Experience. You can use a bonus action to bolster yourself with the soul's life experience, making your next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage. If you don't use this benefit before the start of your next turn, it is lost.

Eyes of the Dead. You can use an action to name a place the humanoid saw in life, which creates an {@condition invisible} sensor somewhere in that place if it is on the plane of existence you're currently on. The sensor remains for as long as you concentrate, up to 10 minutes (as if you were {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). You receive visual and auditory information from the sensor as if you were in its space using your senses.
A creature that can see the sensor (such as one using see invisibility or truesight) sees a translucent image of the tormented humanoid whose soul you caged.

m.text: a tiny silver cage worth 100 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level you can exploit the soul an additional 2 times for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Temporal Shunt

time.condition: which you take when a creature you see within 30ft is about to make an attack roll or cast a spell

entries: You target yourself and the triggering creature. Each target must succeed on a wisdom saving throw or be thrown to the same random point in time. If the triggering creature failed, the attack or spell they were about to make is canceled before it's used. At the start of the triggering creature's next turn, each target returns to the present in the nearest unoccupied space.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target an additional creature of your choice that you can see within 30ft for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Hunter's Mark
entries: You magically mark one creature you can see within range as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage to the target the first time you hit it with an attack roll on any turn. You choose the damage type when you prepare the spell. You also have Advantage on any Wisdom (Perception or Survival) check you make to find it.
If the target drops to 0 or less Hit Points before this spell ends, you can take a Bonus Action to move the mark to a new creature you can see within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours, and the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d6}. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your {@status concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours, and the extra damage increases to {@dice 3d6}.

spell.name: Jump
entries: You touch a willing creature. Once before the start of your next turn they can move up to 10 ft during a jump without spending movement. That movement does not count towards your max jump distance.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of level 2 or higher, the distance they can move without spending movement increases by 10ft for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Zephyr Strike
entries: You can cast this spell as a bonus action before making an attack roll with a weapon. Give the attack roll advantage. Immediately after the attack hits you can move up to 10 ft in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the distance you move by 10 ft for each additional level (up to a maximum of 60 ft).

spell.name: Healing Spirit
entries: You call forth a nature spirit to soothe the wounded. The intangible spirit appears in a space that is a 5-foot cube you can see within range. It looks like a transparent beast or fey.

You can cause the spirit to restore {@dice 1d6} temporary hit points to yourself or a creature you can see (no action required). The target must be within the spirits space. If you do, you cannot heal the target in that way again until the start of its next turn. The spirit can heal a number of times equal to 1 + your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of twice). After healing that number of times, the spirit disappears.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the Spirit up to 30 feet to a space you can see.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 3 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Vortex Warp
entries: You magically twist space around another creature you can see within range that is large or smaller. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (they can choose to fail), or the target is teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The chosen space must be on a surface or in a liquid that can support the target without the target having to squeeze.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range of the spell increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Evard's Black Tentacles

components.m: a piece of tentacle from a giant octopus or a giant squid

entries: Squirming, ebony tentacles fill a 20-foot square on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, flat surfaces in the area are difficult terrain.

Whenever a creature is in the affected area it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and be {@condition restrained} by the tentacles until the start of its next turn. After making the saving throw they don't need to do so again until the start of their next turn. If the creature leaves the area, they are no longer {@condition restrained}.

At the start of each of its turns the target can repeat the saving throw, breaking free on a success. As an action the target or a creature the target is within reach of can make a Strength (Athletics) check against the save DC. On a success, the target is no longer {@condition restrained}.

spell.name: Web
entries: You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs fill a 20-foot Cube there for the duration. The webs are Difficult Terrain, and the area within them is Lightly Obscured.

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn.

Whenever a creature is in the affected area it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the webs until the start of it's next turn. After a creature makes this saving throw it doesn't need to do so again until the start of its next turn. If the creature leaves the area, they are no longer {@condition restrained}.

At the start of each of its turns the {@condition restrained} creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success it is no longer {@condition restrained}. As an action the target or a creature the target is within reach of can make a Strength (Athletics) check against the save DC. On a success, it is no longer {@condition restrained}.

If the webs are exposed to fire they all burn. Any creature that is {@condition restrained} by the webs while they are burning takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage. Once they take this damage they cannot take it again until the start of their next turn. After 1 round of burning, all the webs are burned away and the spell ends.

spell.name: Ceremony

m.text: 25 gp worth of powdered silver, which the spell consumes

entries: Choose one of the following ceremonies. Decorations for that type of ceremony worth a total of 50 gp appear in locations of your choice within 15 ft of where you began casting this spell. After 24 hours the decorations disappear. Anyone who closely inspects the decorations can see that they are fake. Once within the duration while you and your targets are in the affected area you can use your action to perform the effect for this type of ceremony (listed below).

entries.name: Atonement
entries: You touch one willing creature whose alignment has changed, and you make a DC 20 Wisdom (Insight) check. On a successful check, you restore the target to its original alignment.

entries.name: Bless Water
entries: You touch one vial of water and cause it to become holy water.

entries.name: Coming of Age
entries: You touch one humanoid who is a young adult. For the next 24 hours, they cannot be aged (magically or otherwise). A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Dedication
entries: You touch one humanoid who wishes to be dedicated to your diety's service. Once within the next 24 hours when you cast a spell with a range of touch the creature can use their reaction to deliver the spell with their touch instead of yours if they are within 90 ft of you. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.

entries.name: Funeral Rite
entries: You touch one corpse, and for the next 7 days, the target can't become undead by any means short of a Wish spell.

entries.name: Wedding
entries: You touch willing adult humanoids. Each target can sense what other alive adult humanoids the other targets have married previously in this way. If the targets are still willing, they are bonded in marriage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of second level or higher, the radius of the spell increases by 15 ft and the perceived price of the decorations is tripled for every spell slot above 1st.

spell.name: Wish
entries: Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter reality itself.

Cast another spell of 8th level or lower without expending a spell slot or its casting time. You do not need to know the spell or have it prepared. This spell's casting time is the casting time of the spell you pick. You don't need to meet any requirements to cast the spell, including costly components.

Instead of casting another spell you can make a boundless wish. State your wish to the DM as precisely as possible. The DM chooses a casting time and effect based on the wish. They can utilize any room for interpretation in the wish to make it do something other than what you intended. If the effect would be more powerful than the spells you could have casted with this spell, the DM prevents this by reducing the power of the effect, adding unintended consequences, or a combination of both.

The stress of casting Wish to produce any effect other than duplicating another spell weakens you. After enduring that stress, each time you cast a spell until you finish a Long Rest, you take {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage per level of that spell. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way. In addition, your Strength score becomes 3 for {@dice 2d4} days. For each of those days that you spend resting and doing nothing more than light activity, your remaining recovery time decreases by 2 days. Finally, there is a 33 percent chance that you are unable to cast Wish ever again if you suffer this stress.

spell.name: Forcecage

m.text: ruby dust worth 1,500+ GP, which the spell consumes

entries: An immobile, {@condition Invisible|XPHB}, Cube-shaped prison composed of magical force springs into existence around an area you choose within range. The prison can be a cage or a solid box, as you choose.

A prison in the shape of a cage can be up to 20 feet on a side and is made from 1/2-inch diameter bars spaced 1/2 inch apart. A prison in the shape of a box can be up to 10 feet on a side, creating a solid barrier that prevents any matter from passing through it and blocking any spells cast into or out from the area.

When you cast the spell, any creature that is completely inside the cage's area is trapped. Creatures only partially within the area, or those too large to fit inside it, are pushed away from the center of the area until they are completely outside it.

A creature inside the cage can't leave it by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to leave, it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can use that magic to exit the cage. On a failed save, the creature doesn't exit the cage and wastes the spell or effect. The cage also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel. The cage has an AC of 5 and 240 hit points.
This spell can't be dispelled by Dispel Magic.

spell.name: Magic Jar

m.text: a gem, crystal, or reliquary worth 500+ GP

entries: Your body falls into a catatonic state as your soul leaves it and enters the container you used for the spell's material component. Any soul that inhabits the container is aware of their surroundings as if they were in the container's space. They cannot move or take actions, reactions, bonus actions or similar acts. You in particular can use your action to attempt to possess the body of a humanoid you can see within 100 ft.

If you attempt to possess a creature, it makes a charisma saving throw. On a failure, your soul moves into the target's body, and the target's soul becomes trapped in the container. They target automatically fails the saving throw if it has no soul. On a success, the target resists your efforts to possess it, and you can't attempt to possess it again for 24 hours. Creatures warded by a protection from evil and good or magic circle spell can't be possessed.

The spell ends on any creature that possesses its own body. A creatures can control the body it is possessing. Its Hit Points, Hit Point Dice, Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Speed, and senses are replaced by the body's. It otherwise keeps its game statistics.
While possessing a body, you can take a Magic action to return to the container if it is within 100 feet of you. If there is already a soul in the container, it moves to the body you left.
If the following happens to a body or container, the soul it contains moves to a different body or to the container (whichever is closest):

items: the container or body is destroyed
the body drops to zero hit points, dies or ceases to be humanoid
the spell ends on a body or the container

entries: The target it moves to must not have a soul and must be within a mile. If a soul remains in a dead body it dies with it.
When the spell ends, the container is destroyed.

spell.name: Compelled Duel
entries: One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains the angered condition against you for 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, you can target one additional creature for each additional level.

spell.name: Geas
entries: You give a verbal command to a creature that you can see within range, ordering it to carry out some service or refrain from an action or a course of activity as you decide. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. The target automatically succeeds if it can't understand your command. If you concentrate on the spell for the full duration, the effect lasts for 30 days.
While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the creature takes {@damage 5d10} Psychic damage if it acts in a manner directly counter to your command. It takes this damage no more than once per 10 minutes.

You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. Should you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.
A Remove Curse, Greater Restoration, or Wish spell ends this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th or 8th level and concentrate on it for the full duration, the effect lasts for 1 year. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level and concentrate on it for the full duration, the effect lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.

spell.name: Tenser's Transformation

components.m: a few hairs from a bull

entries: You endow yourself with endurance and martial prowess fueled by magic. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain 50 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.
You have advantage on attack rolls that you make with  weapons.
When you hit a target with a weapon attack, that target takes an extra {@damage 2d12} force damage.
You have proficiency with all armor, shields, and weapons.
You have proficiency in Strength and Constitution saving throws.
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.
You can drop or stow anything your holding
You can draw up to two weapons
You can instantly don armor that you have on your person

entries: Immediately after the spell ends, you can drop, stow or doff anything you used this spell to draw or don. Additionally, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or your {@condition exhaustion} increases by 1.

spell.name: Blade of Disaster
entries: You create a blade-shaped planar rift about 3 feet long in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The blade lasts for the duration. When you cast this spell, you can make up to two melee spell attacks with the blade, each one against a creature, loose object, or structure within 5 feet of the blade. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d12} force damage. This attack scores a critical hit if the number on the {@dice d20} is 18 or higher. On a critical hit, the blade deals an extra {@damage 8d12} force damage (for a total of {@damage 16d12} force damage).
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the blade up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see and then make up to two melee spell attacks with it again.
The blade can harmlessly pass through any barrier, including a Wall of Force.

spell.name: Onyx Door

time.condition: which you take when a large or smaller creature you can see within 10 ft falls prone

entries: A door made of onyx manifests under the creature and opens for them to fall through. They must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (they can choose to fail), or they are teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. They cannot be teleported further than half their movement speed (ignoring any effects that are setting their movement speed to 0). You can cast this spell at the moment you fall {@condition prone} from going {@condition unconscious}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's range increases by 10 ft when you reach levels 5 (20 feet), 11 (30 feet), and 17 (40 feet).

spell.name: Silent Knight
entries: Touch a willing creature to create a 5 ft radius of silence centered on them until the end of your next turn. While creatures are in the affected area they cannot create sound, cast a spell that includes a verbal component or deal thunder damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration is extended by one round when you reach levels 5 (2 rounds), 11 (3 rounds) and 17 (4 rounds)

spell.name: Acid Mitt
entries: Acid engulfs your hand allowing it to melt through armor and damage the creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Acid damage, and has -1 AC until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Static Fuzz
entries: You release motes of static that float around a creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage, and until the end of your next turn they emit 5ft of bright light and an additional 5ft of dim light. Creatures in the bright light perceive dim light as darkness.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Metabolize
entries: You touch a willing target and expend one of your hit dice. Roll it and add your constitution modifier. They regain a number of Hit Points equal to the roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: You can expend an additional hit die when you reach levels 5 (2 hit dice), 11 (3 hit dice), and 17 (4 hit dice). This only applies to cleric and druid levels.

spell.name: Executioner

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch gets damaged by a creature within 10 ft

entries: A willing creature of your choice within 10 ft moves up to their movement speed straight towards the damager and can spend their reaction to make a melee attack against them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, the distance the damager and the creature you choose can be within increases by 10 ft for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Reclaimed Shrapnel

time.condition: which you take immediately before or after a creature you can touch would fail a saving throw

entries: You push a piece of shrapnel into each wound where they melt into golden light. Heal the target {@dice 2d2} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, add {@dice 2d2} for each additional level.

spell.name: Patchwork
entries: Target a creature you can see within range. Once within the next minute choose a downtime check it starts making. Add 1 to it. If the downtime check takes a minute or less, double this bonus. Do not add this bonus if a spell would already add a bonus to this check. They can forgo such bonuses to benefit from this spell. The bonus cannot apply to checks that take longer than a day. You can cast this spell again to extend that limit by a day. The remaining time in that limit can never exceed 2 days.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the bonus by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Contract
entries: You touch a contract to enchant it. One creature can sign it. If you or a creature that willingly signed the contract violates the terms of the contract then the contract ends, both creatures know the contract has ended and the violator takes {@damage 3d8} radiant, psychic or necrotic damage. Choose the damage type when you prepare the spell. The DM might allow you to replace the damage with an equivalent consequence defined in the contract. This consequence might punish the violator or aid an entity in punishing the violator. Whatever the consequence is, it has no effect whenever it would be used for anything other than punishing the violator.

If the contract is destroyed, the spell ends. The contract has AC equal to 5 + your spellcasting ability and hit points equal to 5 times the level your casting this spell at. A remove curse, greater restoration, or wish spell also ends it if it is casted at a level equal to or greater than the level this spell was casted at.

m.text: A contract made of 10gp worth of paper and ink

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, increase the damage by {@dice 2d8} for each additional slot level. Additionally, increase the duration if the spell is casted at level 3 (1 day), level 4 (1 week), level 5 (1 month), level 6 (1 year), level 7 (1 decade), level 8 (1 century), level 9 (1 millennium).

spell.name: Glide
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a glide speed of 30 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

spell.name: Burrow
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a burrow speed of 60 feet for the duration.

spell.name: Pearly Gate

time.condition: which you take when a large or smaller creature you can see within 10 ft gets up from prone

entries: A lustrous white gate manifests above the creature for them to rise through. They must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (they can choose to fail), or they pass through the gate and are teleported to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. They cannot be teleported further than the movement they spent getting up from {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's range increases by 10 ft when you reach levels 5 (15 feet), 11 (20 feet), and 17 (25 feet).

spell.name: Cloud Jump

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature you can see within 30ft moves

entries: You create a cloud for the target to momentarily step on. If the target is currently jumping, they can change the direction of their jump and can move up to 5 ft in a straight line without spending movement.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, increase the distance they move by 5 ft for every additional level.

spell.name: Haunt
entries: Choose a creature you can see within 30 ft. While you are within 15 ft of the target you cannot be seen or heard except by the target and undead creatures. You show up in reflections, photography, and other things that instantly capture your likeness. If someone can see you or your likeness is captured while you are within the affected area, you appear ghostly and translucent. This spell ends if you harm a creature while you're within the affected area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, target an additional creature for each additional spell level. All of the targets can see and hear you regardless of which radius you're in.

spell.name: Wish Upon
entries: You make a wish upon the source of your magic. Roll a {@dice d2 - 1} and cast a spell of your choice. Its level must be equal to or less than your roll's total and it must be on the spell list that you prepared this spell from. You can prepare this spell multiple times as long as it is prepared from a different spell list each time. You do not expend the casting time or components (except for costly components) to cast it. The casting time of this spell becomes the casting time of the spell you chose. Once you cast Wish Upon in this way, you can't cast it again until you finish a short rest.

Instead of casting a spell of your choice, you can speak aloud a wish. It can be no more than 10 words and it must start with "I wish". The DM chooses a casting time and effect based on the wish. They can utilize any room for interpretation to make the wish do something other than what you intended. If the effect would be more powerful than the spells you could have chosen, the DM prevents this by reducing the power of the effect, adding unintended consequences, or a combination of both. Once you cast Wish Upon in this way, you can't cast it again until you finish a long rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, add a {@dice d2 - 1} to the roll for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Ghostwalk
entries: You are {@condition invisible} until you've moved 5ft, the turn ends, or you harm a creature. Undead creatures can still see you. Additionally, you show up in reflections, photography, and other similar things. If something can see you while you're {@condition invisible}, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The distance you can move increases by 5ft when you reach levels 5 (10 ft), 11 (15 ft), and 17 (20 ft).

spell.name: Snapback
entries: As a bonus action before the end of your next turn you can teleport back to the location where you casted this spell. You can use this once and regain all uses after a short rest. You fail to teleport if the location is occupied or in another plane of existence.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The number of times you can use this spell before resting increases by 1 when you reach Rogue levels 5 (2 uses), 11 (3 uses), and 17 (4 uses).

spell.name: Wreathe

time.condition: which you take before a willing creature you can see within 60 ft hits or misses with an attack roll.

entries: If the attack deals damage, change up to 5 of the damage to a damage type of your choice. On a hit, deal 1 extra damage of the damage type you chose.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level, increase the extra damage by 1 and increase the amount of damage that is converted to a different damage type by 5 for each additional spell level.

My balancing concerns with the spell are not whether I should buff or nerf it, but whether it should exist in the first place. Pure damage output from a reaction with a trigger that will almost certainly trigger does not seem like something that should be in the game. That said, the spell feels cool to cast. Overall I'm experimenting with having reduced effects for reaction spells that have more certain triggers.

spell.name: Maze
entries: You force a creature to succeed on an intelligence saving throw or be banish into an everchanging labyrinthine demiplane.

The target can take a Study action to try to escape. When it does so, it makes a DC 20 Intelligence (Investigation) check. If it succeeds three times in a row, it escapes, and the spell ends. For every 30 ft it moves while in the maze it can use its action in this way without expending an action.
When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Silvery Barbs

time.condition: which you take before a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself succeeds or fails on a d20 test

entries: You grow a reflective barbed plant around a piece of yourself and use it to distract or direct a creature by reflecting light. Reroll the {@dice d20} test. The new roll is only used if it is no more than 1 greater or less than the previous roll. If the new roll is not used, you take 1 piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the damage and the amount the new roll can be greater or less than the previous roll by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Detect Poison and Disease
entries: Replaced by Detect Chemicals. If you would learn this spell, learn the spell that has replaced it instead.

spell.name: Skill Empowerment
entries: Your magic deepens a creature's understanding of its own talent. You touch one willing creature and choose a skill; until the spell ends, add 4 to ability checks it makes using that skill. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.
You must choose a skill in which the target is proficient, but does not have expertise in.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the bonus to ability checks using that skill by 1 for every 2 additional levels.

spell.name: Channel Craftsman

components.m: the insignia of a dead craftsman

entries: Choose a tool mastery. You can use two tool masteries when you make a tool check instead of one. It can be the same mastery twice. One of the tool masteries must be one of the tool masteries you chose. Undead creatures, creatures that can see through invisibility, and instant capturing of your likeness (such as reflections) perceive a spirit guiding your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the number of masteries you choose by 1 for each additional level.

spell.name: Beast Bond

components.m: a bit of fur wrapped in a cloth

entries: You establish a telepathic link with one beast you touch that is willing or {@condition charmed} by you. Until the spell ends, the link is active while you and the beast are within line of sight of each other. Through the link, the beast can understand your telepathic messages to it, and it can telepathically communicate simple emotions and concepts back to you. While the link is active, the beast adds a {@dice d6} to its attack rolls against creatures within your reach.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, change the {@dice d6} to a {@dice d8}. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, change the {@dice d6} to a {@dice d10}.

spell.name: Booming Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes sheathed in booming energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly moves 5 feet or more before then, the target takes thunder damage equal to your proficiency bonus, and the spell ends. You can forgo this additional damage. If you do not, add 1 less mastery to this attack.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: When you reach 5th level, the melee attack deals extra damage of the weapon's damage die on a hit. This increase by 1 die again at 11th level and 17th level.

spell.name: Green-Flame Blade

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make an attack with it against one creature. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause green fire to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes fire damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. If you do target a second creature, add 1 less mastery to this attack.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals extra damage equal to the weapon's damage die of the weapon's damage type, and the fire damage to the second creature increases to {@damage 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls recieve the same increase again at 11th level and 17th level.

spell.name: Spiny Shield

time.condition: which you take when an attack deals damage to a creature you can touch

entries: An barrier of spikes interposes itself between the target and the attacker. Reduce the damage by {@dice 1d6}. If it was a melee attack, deal piercing damage to the attacker equal to the amount reduced.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, increase the amount reduced by {@dice 1d6} for each additional level.

spell.name: Relay

time.condition: which you take when a willing creature targets you with a ranged effect

entries: You help guide a projectile, spell, or other ranged effect to its true target. Change the target to a creature or object you can see within a number of feet equal to the effect's remaining range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, add 10 to the distance you can choose a new target within for each additional level.

spell.name: Find Greater Steed
entries: Removed. If you are granted this spell, learn Find Steed instead.

spell.name: Sickening Radiance
entries: Dim, greenish light spreads within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The light spreads around corners, and it lasts until the spell ends.

When a creature moves into the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@damage 4d10} radiant damage, and increases its {@condition exhaustion} by 1. Additionally, it emits a dim, greenish light in a 5-foot radius. This light makes it impossible for the creature to benefit from being {@condition invisible}. The light and any increases to {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away when the spell ends.

spell.name: Tasha's Mind Whip
entries: You psychically lash out at one creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage, and it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers none of the spell's other effects. At any time a target can take psychic damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus their level to end this spell on themself. If they don't have a level, they use their max number of hit dice instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Animate Objects
entries: Objects animate at your command. Choose a number of nonmagical objects within range that aren't being worn or carried, aren't fixed to a surface, and aren't Gargantuan. The maximum number of objects is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; for this number, a Medium or smaller target counts as one object, a Large target counts as two, and a Huge target counts as three.
