Each target animates, sprouts legs, and becomes a Construct that uses the {@creature Animated Object|GaldeveerTanksandFlanks} stat block; this creature is under your control until the spell ends or until it is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Each creature you make with this spell is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, it shares your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count and takes its turn immediately after yours.

Until the spell ends, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). If you issue no commands, the creature takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and moves only to avoid harm. When the creature drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it reverts to its object form, and any remaining damage carries over to that form.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The creature's Slam damage increases by {@dice 1d4} - 2 (Medium or smaller), {@dice 1d6} - 1 (Large), or {@dice 1d12} (Huge) for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Beast Sense
entries: You touch a Beast that is willing or {@condition charmed} by you. For the duration, you can perceive through the Beast's senses as well as your own. When perceiving through the Beast's senses, you benefit from any special senses it has. If at any point it is neither willing nor {@condition charmed} by you, the spell ends.

spell.name: Bless
entries: You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds {@dice 1d4} to the attack roll or save. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Chill Touch
entries: Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage, and it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d10}), 11 ({@damage 3d10}), and 17 ({@damage 4d10}).

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
entries: You conjure spirits from the Elemental Planes that flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. Until the spell ends, any attack you make deals an extra {@damage 2d8} damage when you hit a creature in the Emanation. This damage is Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning (your choice when you make the attack).
In addition, the ground in the Emanation is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} for your enemies.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for every 2 spell slot levels above 4.

spell.name: Counterspell

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of yourself casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

entries: You attempt to interrupt the casting of a spell. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. Add the level your casting this spell at minus the level of the spell you're countering to your Spell Save DC. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If something such as a spell slot was expended to cast the spell, it is not expended.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (see description above).

spell.name: Crown of Madness
entries: One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. The creature succeeds automatically if it isn't Humanoid.

A spectral crown appears on the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} target's head, and it must use its action before moving on each of its turns to make a melee attack against a creature that you mentally choose. You can only choose itself if there are no other targets within its reach. The target can act normally on its turn if you choose no creature. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.
On your later turns, you must take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action to maintain control of the target, or the spell ends.

spell.name: Cause Fear
entries: One creature that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains the {@condition frightened} condition against you for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shroud of Knight
entries: Touch a willing creature you can see. Until the end of your next turn, dim light is darkness while within 5 ft of that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration is extended by one round when you reach levels 5 (2 rounds), 11 (3 rounds) and 17 (4 rounds)

spell.name: Daylight
entries: For the duration, sunlight spreads from a point within range and fills a 60-foot-radius Sphere. The sunlight's area is {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} and sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 60 feet.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the sunlight to fill a 60-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the sunlight.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} created by a spell of level 3 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casted at higher levels, increase the level of spell that this spell can dispel by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Dancing Lights
entries: You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing vague silhouette of yourself. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} in a 10-foot radius.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Find Steed
entries: You summon an otherworldly spirit to act as your Steed. It manifests as a large animal in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Steed|GaldeveerTanksAndFlanks} stat block.

Choose the Steed's creature type when you prepare this spell: Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. Choose the steed's environment when you summon it: Air, Water, Land. The Steed resembles a large animal of your choice—such as an horse, a shark, or a hippogriff—that is native to the chosen environment. Both choices determine certain traits in the stat block. The Steed is your ally and obeys all of your commands.

entries.name: Disappearance of the Steed
entries: The steed disappears if it drops to 0 hit points or the spell ends. When it does, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. When you cast this spell, you decide whether you summon a steed that has previously disappeared or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Special.

spell.name: Awaken Steed
entries: You expend a piece of your life force to awaken a creature as your steed. Choose a large beast you can see within 10 ft that has a CR of zero. It becomes your steed. At any time you or the steed can end this spell. While this spell is active, your maximum hit points are reduced by twice this spell's level.

entries.name: Mind
entries: They are as intelligent as a person and know any languages that you know. Add 5 to their intelligence score. They have telepathy with you while you are within 120ft of them. They are your ally and generally obey your commands.

entries.name: Stats
entries: Your Steed uses your proficiency bonus instead of its own. Add half the level of this spell to your Steed's AC. Add quadruple this spell's level to their hit point maximum. Add half of this spell's level rounded up whenever they make a strength or constitution ability check or saving throw.

entries.name: Attacking
entries: When your Steed makes an attack roll, it uses half of your spellcasting attack modifier. Whenever they hit with an attack, they deal extra damage equal to twice this spell's level. The damage type is thunder, lightning, fire, cold or acid. Choose the damage type when you cast this spell. You can change it whenever you level up.

entries.name: Spell Slot
entries: Until this spell ends, you cannot use the spell slot you used to cast this spell and you cannot unprepared this spell. If you expend a use of a feature that has an effect on the spell for its full duration, you can't expend that use until the spell ends.

entries.name: Recasting
entries: If the target already has this spell on it, end it and replace it with this one.

entries.name: Death
entries: If your steed dies or otherwise stops being your steed, this spell ends and you gain a stress. The steed cannot be dispelled.

entries.name: Higher CR
entries: If their CR is greater than zero, divide their hit point maximum, any damage they deal, and any hit points they recover from hit dice by the corresponding value below. Do this before apply any bonuses granted by this spell or elsewhere. Additionally, any time this spell refers to spell level, reduce it by the corresponding level.
CR :  5, 1 level
CR :  6, 2 levels
CR :  7, 3 levels
CR 1: 13, 4 levels

entries.name: Size
entries: If you choose a creature that is not large, subtract 1 from their AC for each size greater or smaller than large.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special

spell.name: Awaken Familiar
entries: You expend a piece of your life force to awaken a creature as your familiar. Choose a tiny beast you can see within 10 ft that has a CR of zero. It becomes your familiar. At any time you or the familiar can end this spell. While this spell is active, your maximum hit points are reduced by twice this spell's level.

entries.name: Mind
entries: They are as intelligent as a person and know any languages that you know. Add 5 to their intelligence score. They have telepathy with you while you are within 120ft of them. They are your ally and generally obey your commands.

entries.name: Stats
entries: Your familiar uses your proficiency bonus instead of its own. Add half the level of this spell to your familiar's AC. Add twice this spell's level to their hit point maximum. Add half of this spell's level rounded up whenever they make a wisdom or dexterity ability check or saving throw.

entries.name: Attacking
entries: When your familiar makes an attack roll, it uses your spellcasting attack modifier. Whenever they hit with an attack, they deal extra damage equal to this spell's level. The damage type is thunder, lightning, fire, cold or acid. Choose the damage type when you cast this spell. You can change it whenever you level up.

entries.name: Deliver Spell
entries: When you cast a spell with a range of touch, the familiar can spend their reaction to deliver the spell with its touch. They must be within 120 feet of you to do so.

entries.name: Spell Slot
entries: Until this spell ends, you cannot use the spell slot you used to cast this spell and you cannot unprepared this spell. If you expend a use of a feature and it has an effect on this spell for its full duration, you can't use that use until this spell ends.

entries.name: Recasting
entries: If the target already has this spell on it, end it and replace it with this one.

entries.name: Death
entries: If your familiar dies or otherwise stops being your familiar, this spell ends and you gain a stress. The familiar cannot be dispelled.

entries.name: Higher CR
entries: If their CR is greater than zero, divide their hit point maximum, any damage they deal, and any hit points they recover from hit dice by the corresponding value below. Do this before apply any bonuses granted by this spell or elsewhere. Additionally, any time this spell refers to spell level, reduce it by the corresponding level.
CR :  5, 1 level
CR :  6, 2 levels
CR :  7, 3 levels
CR 1: 13, 4 levels

entries.name: Size
entries: If you choose a creature that is not tiny, subtract 1 from their AC for each size greater or smaller than tiny.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special

spell.name: Find Familiar
entries: You summon an otherworldly spirit to act as your familiar. It manifests as a little animal in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This creature uses the {@creature Otherworldly Familiar|GaldeveerTanksAndFlanks} stat block.

Choose the familiar's creature type when you prepare this spell: Celestial, Fey, or Fiend. Choose what type of animal the familiar is when you summon it: Bird, Fish, Quadraped, Insect. The familiar resembles a Tiny animal of your choice—such as an owl, a cat, or a frog. Both choices determine certain traits in the stat block. The familiar is your ally and obeys all of your commands.

entries.name: Disappearance of the familiar
entries: The familiar disappears if it drops to 0 hit points or the spell ends. When it does, it leaves behind anything it was wearing or carrying. When you cast this spell, you decide whether you summon a familiar that has previously disappeared or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special

spell.name: Eyebite
entries: For the duration, your eyes become an inky void. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice for the duration.

On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to target another creature but can't target a creature again if it has succeeded on a save against this casting of the spell.

entries.name: Asleep
entries: The target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

entries.name: Panicked
entries: The target has the Angered condition. On each of its turns, the Angered target must take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action and move away from you by the safest and shortest route available. If the target moves to a space at least 60 feet away from you where it can't see you, this effect ends.

entries.name: Sickened
entries: The target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for one day. Each time it fails the saving throw, increase it by a day.

spell.name: Conjure Fey
entries: You conjure a Medium spirit from the Feywild in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The spirit lasts for the duration, and it looks like a Fey creature of your choice. When the spirit appears, you can make one melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes Psychic damage equal to {@damage 3d12} plus your spellcasting ability modifier, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} or Angered condition until the start of your next turn, with both you and the spirit as the source of the fear or anger.

As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your later turns, you can teleport the spirit to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of the space it left and make the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d12|6-9|2d12} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Illusory Dragon
entries: By gathering threads of shadow material from the Shadowfell, you create a Huge shadowy dragon in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The illusion lasts for the spell's duration and occupies its space, as if it were a creature.

When the illusion appears, any of your enemies that can see it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of it for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} creature has disadvantage on attack rolls while the source of its fear is within its line of sight. If a {@condition frightened} creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the illusion, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 60 feet. At any point during its movement, you can cause it to exhale a blast of energy in a 60-foot cone originating from its space. When you create the dragon, choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or poison. Each creature in the cone must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 7d6} damage of the chosen damage type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The illusion is tangible because of the shadow stuff used to create it, but attacks miss it automatically, it succeeds on all saving throws, and it is immune to all damage and conditions. A creature that uses an action to examine the dragon can determine that it is an illusion by succeeding on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through it and has advantage on saving throws against its breath.

spell.name: Wrathful Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike

entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage from the attack, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Angered condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the Angered target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Ray of Sickness
entries: You shoot a greenish ray at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} Poison damage and has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. The {@condition poisoned} creature has disadvantage on saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Contagion
entries: Your touch inflicts a magical contagion. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 11d8} Necrotic damage and have the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws or ability checks made with the chosen ability.

The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends on the target. If the target fails three of the saves, the spell lasts for 7 days on it.

Whenever the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} target receives an effect that would end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition doesn't end on it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The duration doubles for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Detect Chemicals
entries: For the duration, you sense the location of poisons, acids, poisonous or venomous creatures, acidic creatures, oozes and magical contagions within 30 feet of yourself. You sense the kind of poison, acid, creature, or contagion in each case.
The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

spell.name: Dispel Magic
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. For each ongoing spell on the target make an ability check using your spellcasting ability and add the level you're casting this spell at. The DC is 10 plus the twice opposing spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Special (See description)

spell.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} Force damage. At the end of their next turn, they take {@damage 1d6} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The initial damage increases by {@dice 1d4} and the delayed damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d4}) ({@dice 2d6}), 11 ({@dice 3d4}) ({@dice 3d6}), and 17 ({@dice 4d4}) ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Malign Missile
entries: You create a glowing dart of necrotic energy which strikes a target you can see within range, dealing {@damage 1d4} Necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach warlock levels 5 ({@dice 2d4}), 11 ({@dice 3d4}), and 17 ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Find Traps
entries: You sense any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap, for the purpose of this spell, includes any object or mechanism that was created to cause damage or other danger. Thus, the spell would sense the {@spell Alarm|XPHB} or {@spell Glyph of Warding|XPHB} spell or a mechanical pit trap, but it wouldn't reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole.
This spell reveals that a trap is present and the direction it is in but not its location. You do learn the general nature of the danger posed by a trap you sense.

spell.name: Enhance Ability
entries: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose an ability score. For the duration of this spell they add a {@dice d6} to ability checks they make that use that ability score. Do not add it if a positive bonus has already been applied to the roll by a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2. You can choose a different ability for each target.

spell.name: Entangle
entries: Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. At the start of each of the {@condition restrained} creature's turns it can repeat the saving throw, breaking free on a success. A {@condition Restrained|XPHB} creature or a creature it is within reach of can take an action to make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your spell save DC. On a success, it breaks free.

spell.name: Enthrall
entries: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, the target does not notice you casting this spell and has a -10 penalty to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and Passive {@skill Perception|XPHB} until the spell ends.

spell.name: Fabricate
entries: Select a gathering point of interest. Gathering checks on that point of interest and crafting checks using only materials from that point of interest during the duration of this spell take a 60th as long.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Increase the duration to an hour if you cast this at 5th or higher.

spell.name: Befuddlement

components.m: a key ring with no keys

entries: You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target makes Intelligence saving throw now and at the end of each of its turns.

If the target succeeds three times the spell ends. If they failed three times, they take {@damage 10d12} Psychic damage and can't cast spells or take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action. At the end of every 30 days, the target starts making the saves again, ending the effect on three successes. The effect can also be ended by the {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB}, {@spell Heal|XPHB}, or {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.
On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

spell.name: Hypnotic Pattern
entries: You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. While {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, the creature has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 0. At the end of each of its turns the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

spell.name: Identify
entries: You touch an object throughout the spell's casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB}, any curses placed on it and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell's name.
If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

spell.name: Leomund's Tiny Hut
entries: A 10-foot Emanation springs into existence around you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell fails when you cast it if the Emanation isn't big enough to fully encapsulate all creatures in its area.

Creatures and objects within the Emanation when you cast the spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells of level 3 or lower can't be cast through it, and the effects of such spells can't extend into it.

The atmosphere inside the Emanation is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside. Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to have {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} or {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB} (no action required). The Emanation is opaque from the outside and of any color you choose, but it's transparent from the inside.
The spell ends early if you leave the Emanation or if you cast it again. The dome has an AC of 5 and 60 hit points. A disintegrate spell destroys it instantly.

spell.name: Mage Hand
entries: A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you can see within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast this spell and as an action you can control the hand. If you do, you can move it up to 30 ft and have it perform one object interaction. The hand can hold one object that is 10 pounds or less, cannot exert more than 10 pounds of force, cannot deal damage and has no sense of touch.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Heat Metal

components.m: a piece of iron and a flame

entries: Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage. The creature can drop the object to avoid taking the damage if they can.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|2-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 2.

spell.name: Goodberry
entries: Ten berries appear in your hand and are infused with magic for the duration. A creature can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to eat one berry. Eating a berry restores 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}.
Uneaten berries disappear when the spell ends.

spell.name: Friends
entries: You magically emanate a sense of friendship toward one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for the duration. The target succeeds automatically if it isn't a Humanoid, if you're fighting it, or if you have cast this spell on it within the past 24 hours.

The spell ends early if the target takes damage or if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or force anyone to make a saving throw. When the spell ends, the target knows it was {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by you.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Hellish Rebuke

time.condition: which you take in response to a creature you can touch taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself

entries: The damager is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d10|1-9|1d10} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Mending
entries: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.
This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Message
entries: You point toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1 foot of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Minor Illusion
entries: You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

entries.name: Sound
entries: If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

entries.name: Image
entries: If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

spell.name: Sear Wounds
entries: A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your spellcasting modifier. Once before the end of your next turn before they hit or miss with a weapon attack they can imbue their attack with fire. If it hits, they can deal extra fire damage equal to {@dice 1d8}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d10} and the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Blade

time.condition: which you take before a creature you can see within 60 ft hits or misses an attack roll that has disadvantage

entries: Add 1 to the attack roll. The bonus is not applied if the attack roll is already being increased by a spell. The target can forgo such increases in order to benefit from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the bonus by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Holy Word
entries: A creature you can see within 60 ft regains a number of Hit Points equal to {@dice 1d4}. Once before the end of your next turn before they hit or miss with a weapon attack they can imbue their weapon with holy light. If they hit, they deal extra radiant damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your spellcasting modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@damage 1d4} and damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Freeze Wound

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d12} and the total movement they can reduce increases by 10 ft for each additional spell level.

You touch a creature and grant them {@dice 1d12} hit points. Until the end of your next turn whenever a creature moves in their commanded space they can reduce their movement. They can remove no more than 10 ft of movement in this way.

spell.name: Vision

time.condition: which you take immediately before a target you can touch would be targeted by a creature.

entries: The target can move up to 10 ft. If the targeter did something immediately before the triggering event that caused said event, they can choose to stop before they do it. The thing they chose to stop doing doesn't expend or do anything because it never happened. You and the target are the only ones that remember it happening.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the movement by 10 ft for each addtional spell level

spell.name: Warding Word
entries: 3 creatures you can see within range regain hit points. The total amount that can be regained collectively is equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting modifier. Once when one of them takes damage before the end of your next turn you can reduce it by {@dice 1d4}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d6} and the damage reduction increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Demon Blood
entries: Choose a target you can see within 60 ft. Restore hit points to them equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier. They cannot be {@condition frightened} until the end of your next turn. If they are already {@condition frightened}, then the condition is suppressed for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Angel Blood
entries: Choose a target you can see within range. Restore hit points to them equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier. They cannot be angered until the end of your next turn. If they are already angered, then the condition is suppressed for the duration

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 1

spell.name: Pixie Dust
entries: A creature you can see within range regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier and can immediately fly up to 10 ft.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d4} and the movement increases by 5 ft for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Painshift
entries: Choose 3 creatures you can see within range. Until the end of your next turn whenever a target takes damage you can reduce it. The total amount you can reduce in this way is equal to {@dice 1d12} plus your spellcasting modifier. The creature that dealt the damage takes psychic damage equal to the amount reduced. If there isn't a creature that dealt the damage, the damage cannot be reduced in this way.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The amount reduced increases by {@dice 1d12} for each spell level above 1.

spell.name: Mend Shadow
entries: Up to 3 creatures you can see within range regain hit points. The total amount you can heal in this way is equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting modifier. Once before the end of your next turn when a creature misses one of the targets with an attack you can deal necrotic damage to the attacker equal to {@dice 1d4}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d6} and the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot above 1.

spell.name: Briar Stitch

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d12} and the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

A creature you can see within range regains a number of Hit Points equal to {@dice 1d12}. Once before the end of your next turn when a creature would leave the target's commanded space the target can deal piercing damage to them equal to {@dice 1d4} plus your spellcasting modifier.

spell.name: Petrify Wound
entries: A creature you see within 30 ft regains a number of Hit Points equal to {@dice 1d10} plus your spellcasting modifier. Until the end of your next turn whenever a creature the target can touch would be hit with an attack roll the target can increase their AC against that attack. No more than 1 can be added to AC in this way. Do not apply this bonus if a bonus is already being added to their AC by a spell. They can forgo such bonuses to benefit from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d10} and the total amount they can add to their AC increases by 1.

spell.name: Pixie Jar
entries: Choose a target you can see within 60 ft. Once when they drop to zero or less hit points they can heal themself {@dice 2d10} + your spellcasting modifier. If the spell ends before this happens, grant the healing. This cannot bring their hit points to a total higher than what they were at when this spell was casted.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@scaledice 2d10|1-9|2d10} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Deathmarch
entries: You grant temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} plus your spellcasting modifier to a target you can see within 90 ft. They have immunity to the {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition stunned} and {@condition unconscious} conditions until the end of their next round. Reduce their temporary hit points by the amount gained at the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the temporary hit points by {@dice 1d8} for each additional level.

spell.name: Mage Armor
entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 10 plus its Dexterity modifier plus this spell's level. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Special

spell.name: Ward

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch would get hit by an attack roll

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the damage prevented by 3 for each additional spell level
Prevent the next 5 damage that the target takes before the end of your next turn. The damage can be spread out across multiple instances.

spell.name: Lost Trinket

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range drops an object.

entries: Teleport the object to a location you can see within 10 ft of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, add 10 to the distance you can teleport it and to the range of this spell for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Penance

time.condition: which you take after a creature you can touch is damaged by an attack

entries: The target gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6}. The amount of temporary hit points gained cannot exceed the amount of damage they took from the attack. They gain the temporary hit points after taking the damage. If the temporary hit points are still there after a minute, they disappear.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The temporary hit points increases by {@dice 1d6} for each additional level.

spell.name: Recall Thief
entries: You touch a target, anchoring them to their current location. When the target takes damage, the spell ends on them. When the spell ends on a target, they teleport to the location they were at when the spell was casted as long as it is unoccupied and within 100ft. The teleportation fails if the location is in a different plane of existence.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, you can choose an additional target for each additional level.

spell.name: Recall Scout
entries: You anchor a willing creature you can see within range to yourself. When the target takes the attack or magic action or it takes damage, the spell ends on them. When the spell ends on a target, they teleport to the unoccupied location nearest to you. The teleportation fails if the location is in a different plane of existence. If you take damage, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, you can choose an additional target for each additional level.

spell.name: Greater Recall Thief
entries: You touch a willing target, anchoring them to their current location. When the target takes damage, you make a saving throw against the damage as if you are {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell. On a failure, the spell ends on the target. When the spell ends on a target, they teleport to the location they were at when the spell was casted as long as it is unoccupied and within 300ft. The teleportation fails if the location is in a different plane of existence.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, you can choose an additional target for each additional level.

spell.name: Greater Recall Scout

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell at higher levels, you can choose an additional target for each additional level.

You anchor a willing creature you can see within range to you. When the target takes the magic or attack action, the spell ends on them. When the target takes damage, the spell ends on them unless they are unwilling. When the spell ends on a target, they teleport to the unoccupied location nearest to you unless they are unwilling. If you take damage, the spell ends.

spell.name: Phantom Prosthesis
entries: You touch a willing creature to allow them to ignore some of their wounds for 1 minute. The total rank of those wounds must be 1 or less.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the rank by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Create Lifelines
entries: You choose up to 7 willing targets, and a point that is within 20 ft of those targets, that you can see within range. If the point is on an object, it moves with the object. When the target leaves a 20 ft radius around the point, they are teleported to the unoccupied space that is nearest to the chosen point. As a reaction they can prevent themself from teleporting in this way. If the point is on an object that is connected to a structure, you can choose for the radius to be around the structure instead when you cast this spell.

spell.name: Aura of Life
entries: An aura radiates from you in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} for the duration. While in the aura, you and your allies have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage, and your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} maximums can't be reduced. If an ally with zero or less Hit Points starts its turn in the aura, that ally regains hit points equal to {@dice 3d10} + your spellcasting modifier.

spell.name: Aura of Vitality
entries: An aura radiates from you in a 30-foot emanation for the duration. When you create the aura and at the start of each of your turns while it persists, you can restore {@dice 2d4} Hit Points to one creature in it. That creature has an extra 15 ft of movement until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Link Thoughts
entries: You touch a creature to establish a telepathy with them. You have telepathy with the target for the next ten minutes while they are within 120 ft of you.

spell.name: Tinkertoy
entries: You touch a Tiny non-magical object and give it a magical properties. Choose the property from the options below.

entries.name: Light
entries: The object sheds bright light in a 10-foot cone and dim light for an additional 10 feet in the direction it is pointed.

entries.name: Recording
entries: Whenever tapped by a creature, the object emits a recorded message that can be heard within a radius of your choice (max 30ft). You utter the message and choose the radius when you bestow this property on the object, and the recording can be no more than 6 seconds long.

entries.name: Odor
entries: The object continuously emits your choice of a mild odor or nonverbal sound (wind, waves, chirping, or the like) that can be sensed within a radius of your choice (max 30 ft).

entries.name: Stamp
entries: A static visual effect appears on one of the object's surfaces. This effect can be a picture, up to 25 words of text, lines and shapes, or a mixture of these elements, as you like.

The properties last indefinitely, but they end if you forget the cantrip. You can have no more than three properties at the same time. If you try to exceed the maximum, one of the properties ends and the new property applies. A single object can bear only one of these properties at a time. As an action, you can end one of the properties.

spell.name: Vortex Seed
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the next 10 minutes as a reaction when the target moves or falls {@condition prone} within 60 ft of you, you can teleport them to an unoccupied space you touch.

spell.name: Momento Recall
entries: You touch a willing target and an object they are touching. The target can choose to end the spell on themself at any time. The spell ends if the object is destroyed. When the spell ends, they teleport to the unoccupied space that is nearest to the object.

spell.name: Patronage
entries: You touch a target creating a bond that allows you to act as a patron for them for the next hour. You can spend your reaction to allow the target to cast a spell you know that has a range of self. They cast it at 2nd level or lower and it expends your spell slots. If it requires a non-costly material component, it can use any spellcasting focus that you would be able to cast it with. All spells casted in this way end when this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The maximum level of spell they can cast in this way is increased by 1 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Sensing
entries: You gain telepathy with a willing creature you have met or a willing creature described to you by someone who has met it. It lasts for 10 minutes. While you have this telepathy you can sense what the target senses. The spell fails if they are in a different plane than you.

spell.name: Disguise Object
entries: You make an object look different until the spell ends. The object can seem up to a fifth larger or smaller and heavier or lighter. The disguise must have the same basic shape as the original object. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to make the object larger, objects can pass through the additional mass, and anyone who touches it would see their hand pass through.
To discern the disguised, a creature must take the Study action to look for illusions and succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

spell.name: Promise
entries: You lace a promise that was just spoken within the last minute by a target you can hear within range with an enchantment. If the promise is broken or the spell ends, the target knows it. Any creature that the promise was made too also knows it if they were within range when the spell was casted.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast the spell at higher levels, the duration increases to 1 week (2nd level), 1 month (3rd level), 1 year (4th level), Until Dispelled (5th level)

spell.name: Familiar Eyes
entries: You touch a target to link their senses to your own for an hour. As a Bonus Action, you use the target's sight and hearing instead of your own. While doing so, their eyes look like yours and your own eyes look blank. You can use your bonus action again to switch back to your own sight and hearing. You benefit from any special senses the target has while you're using their sight and hearing in this way.

spell.name: Upgrade
entries: You touch an object, turning it into an upgraded version of itself that costs 50 gp more. You can't cast this on an object that costs more than the costly component. Roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1 or 2 the spell fails and material components are wasted. Otherwise, the object's cost increases and it becomes a similar magic item that matches the new cost. For example, a sword might become a +1 sword. It's up to the DM how it gets upgraded. The DM might decide you can't cast the spell at a certain level on a certain object if there isn't a close enough magic item for it to become. Instead of gaining improvements, the item might loose a curse.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The cost of the material component and the cost increase are multiplied by 4 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Mass Petrify Wounds
entries: Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Each target regains Hit Points equal to {@dice 5d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. Until the end of your next turn whenever a creature would be hit by an attack roll a target that can touch them can increase their AC against that attack roll. This spell can add no more than 5 to AC in total. They cannot do this if their AC is already being increased by a spell. They can forgo such increases to benefit from this.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The total amount AC can be increased by increases by 1 for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Mass Pixie Dust
entries: Up to 6 creatures you can see within 90 ft regain hit points equal to 2 + your spellcasting modifier and can immediately fly up to 5 ft.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by 1 and the movement increases by 5 ft for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Rain Demonblood
entries: Choose up to 6 targets you can see within 60 ft. Restore hit points to them equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier. They cannot be {@condition frightened} until the end of your next turn. If they are already {@condition frightened}, then the condition is suppressed for the duration

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d4} and the movement increases by 5 ft for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Rain Angelblood
entries: Choose up to 6 targets you can see within 60 ft. Restore hit points to them equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier. They cannot be angered until the end of your next turn. If they are already angered, then the condition is suppressed for the duration

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d4} and the movement increases by 5 ft for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Deepen Shadow
entries: Choose three creatures that you can see within range. Darkness pours into their shadows, restoring hit points to each target. You can heal up to a total of 35 hit points in this way. Once within the next minute when one of the targets is missed by an attack you can deal damage to the attacker equal to 35 minus the total amount healed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by 5 for each additional level.

spell.name: Mass Freeze Wounds
entries: A wave of freezing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains Hit Points equal to {@dice 5d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. Force each creature within the area of effect that was not chosen to make a constitution saving throw. On a failure, their movement is reduced by 15 ft until the end of their next round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by {@dice 1d6} and the amount their movement is reduced increases by 5 ft for each additional level.

spell.name: Holy Phrase
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. Positive energy washes through the target, restoring up to 35 Hit Points. Once within the next minute before the target hits or misses with a weapon attack they can imbue their weapon with holy light. If they hit, they deal damage equal to 35 minus the amount healed. They emanate 10 ft of bright light and 10 ft of dim light until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing increases by 5 for each additional level.

spell.name: Mass Sear Wounds
entries: A pulse of fire ripples out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains Hit Points equal to {@dice 5d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. Instead of granting healing to a target, you can force that target to make a dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take {@damage 5d6} fire damage. On a success they take half as much damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing and damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each spell slot level above 5.

spell.name: Luck Curse

time.condition: which you can take when a target breaks a promise to a creature you can touch

entries: If the creature you touched or one of its allies have broken a promise to the triggering creature or its allies within the last hour, the spell has no effect. Once within the next day you can subtract 1 from an ability check the triggering creature makes before it succeeds or fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The number of times you can reduce ability checks increases by 1 for each additional level. You can reduce the same ability check multiple times.

spell.name: Retribution

time.condition: which you can take when a target forces a creature you can touch to make a saving throw

entries: Once within the next 10 minutes when the triggering creature would succeed on a saving throw of the same type, you can subtract one from it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the amount subtract by 1 for each additional level.

spell.name: Takeknot

time.condition: which you can take when a creature you can see or hear within 90 ft partakes in that which was freely offered.

entries: The thing they partake in must be something they need that has consequences if they don't receive it. For example, not eating can result in {@condition exhaustion}, therefore eating food that is freely offered can trigger this. The target becomes {@condition charmed} for three hours by the creature that offered them what they partook in. They are also {@condition charmed} by anyone else who partook in what was offered. If one of the charming creatures harms the triggering creature or its allies or is unreasonably inhospitable to them, the triggering creature is no longer {@condition charmed} by them and their allies. This spell counts as a curse. The target knows that its {@condition charmed}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the duration by three hours for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Offerknot

time.condition: which you can take when a creature you can see or hear within 90 ft prevents or protests the taking of that which was freely offered

entries: The target makes a saving throw. On a failure, they become {@condition frightened} or angered by the taker for one hour. If {@condition frightened} was chosen, this lasts until the taker harms a creature that is {@condition frightened} by them. If angered was chosen, this lasts until the taker harms a creature that isn't angered by them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the duration by 1 hour for each additional level.

spell.name: Red Ribbons

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can touch would fail one of the chosen types of saving throws

entries: Choose three types of saving throws when you prepare this spell.
Add 1 to the saving throw. Do not add this if a spell is already adding a positive bonus to the saving throw. The target can forgo such a bonus in order to benefit from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: Increase the amount added by 1 for each additional level.

spell.name: Blood Curse

time.condition: which you can take when a target you can see within range forces a creature you can touch to make a saving throw

entries: If the creature you touched has forced the triggering creature or its allies to make a saving throw within the past 10 minutes, this spell has no effect. Once within the next day you can deal {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to the triggering creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each additional level.

spell.name: Guilt Curse

time.condition: which you can take when a target harms a creature you can touch

entries: If the creature you touched has harmed the triggering creature or its allies within the past hour, this spell has no effect. Once within the next day you can reduce the triggering creature's movement speed by 5 ft. Once you do, at the start of each of their turns they can make a wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell at a higher level you can reduced their movement speed by an additional 5 ft for each additional level.

spell.name: Painkill
entries: Choose 3 creatures you can see within 30 ft. Once when one of the targets takes damage before the end of your next turn, they can reduce it by {@dice 4d10} plus your spellcasting modifier. Creatures in a 60 ft line starting at the target are forced to make a constitution saving throw. They take psychic damage equal to the amount of damage that was removed on a failure or half as much damage on a success

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The amount reduced increases by {@dice 1d10} for each additional level.

spell.name: Briar Cast
entries: A creature you can see within range regains 50 hit points. The target can deal piercing damage to any creature that leaves their commanded space. The total damage they can deal in this way is equal to 15.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by 3 and healing increases by 7 for each additional spell level.

spell.name: Mass Warding Word
entries: Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to {@dice 1d4} plus your spellcasting ability modifier. Until the end of your turn whenever one of the targets is damaged by an attack you can reduce it by {@dice 1d4}. You can do this a number of times equal to the number of targets.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The healing and reduction increases by {@scaledice 1d4|3-9|1d4} for each spell slot level above 3.

spell.name: Maze
entries: You banish a creature that you can see within range into a labyrinthine demiplane. The target remains there for the duration or until it escapes the maze.

The target can take a {@action Study|XPHB} action to try to escape. When it does so, it makes a {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check. If it succeeds three times, it escapes, and the spell ends. For every 30 ft it moves in the maze it can take the study action without spending its action. If they target the maze with an effect, that is the same as targeting you. Damage they deal to you in this way does not cause you to make checks to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. If they target you in this way, until the end of your next turn you can target them as if you were the maze and you could see them.
When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Disintegrate
entries: You launch a green ray at a target you can see within range. The target can be a creature, a nonmagical object, or a creation of magical force, such as the wall created by {@spell Wall of Force|XPHB}.

A creature targeted by this spell makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d6 + 40} Force damage. If this damage reduces it to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it rolls a death saving throw. On a failure, it and everything nonmagical it is wearing and carrying are disintegrated into gray dust. The target can be revived only by a {@spell True Resurrection|XPHB} or a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.

This spell automatically disintegrates a Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force. If such a target is Huge or larger, this spell disintegrates a 10-foot-{@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} portion of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 10d6 + 40|6-9|3d6} for each spell slot level above 6.

spell.name: Primal Edge

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entries: When you learn this cantrip choose the barbarian, fighter or ranger class. Then, choose a weapon mastery from that class's mastery list. You can learn this cantrip multiple times. If you do, instead of learning this cantrip again choose another mastery.

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make an attack with it. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects. You can use any of the chosen weapon masteries on this attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals extra damage equal to the weapon's damage die of the weapons damage type. This increases by one weapon damage die at 11th level and 17th level.

spell.name: Divine Edge

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals extra damage equal to the weapon's damage die of the weapons damage type. This increases by one weapon damage die at 11th level and 17th level.

When you learn this cantrip choose the rogue, monk or paladin class. Then, choose a weapon mastery from that class's mastery list. You can learn this cantrip multiple times. If you do, instead of learning this cantrip again choose another mastery.

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make an attack with it. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects. You can use any of the chosen weapon masteries on this attack.

spell.name: Storied Edge

races.name: Half-Elf (Variant; Moon Elf or Sun Elf Descent)

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: At 5th level, the attack deals extra damage equal to the weapon's damage die of the weapons damage type. This increases by one weapon damage die at 11th level and 17th level.

When you learn this cantrip choose the Artificer, Warlock, Fighter or Monk class. Then, choose a weapon mastery from that class's mastery list. You can learn this cantrip multiple times. If you do, instead of learning this cantrip again choose another mastery.

You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make an attack with it. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects. You can use any of the chosen weapon masteries on this attack.

spell.name: Blinding Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon attack

entries: The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 3d8} Radiant damage from the attack, and the target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the spell ends. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} target makes a Constitution saving throw, ending the spell on itself on a success. Use d6s instead if the attack is ranged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d8|3-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 3. Use d6s instead if the attack is ranged.

spell.name: Banishing Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon attack

entries: The target hit by the attack roll takes an extra {@damage 5d10} Force damage from the attack. If the attack reduces the target to 50 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fewer, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw. They repeat this saving throw at the start of each of their turns. If they fail three times, they are transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration and they stop making the saving throws. While there, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. If they succeed three times the spell ends. Use d8s instead if the attack is ranged.

spell.name: Divine Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a target with a weapon attack

entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 2d8} Radiant damage from the attack. The damage increases by {@damage 1d8} if the target is a Fiend or an Undead. Use d6s instead of the attack is ranged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each spell slot level above 1. Use d6s instead of the attack is ranged.

spell.name: Searing Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a target with a weapon attack

entries: As you hit the target, it takes an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage from the attack. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target takes {@damage 1d6} Fire damage and then makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell continues. On a successful save, the spell ends. Use d4s instead of the attack is ranged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: All the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each spell slot level above 1. Use d4s instead of the attack is ranged.

spell.name: Shining Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a creature with a weapon attack

entries: The target hit by the strike takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Radiant damage from the attack. Until the spell ends, the target sheds {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 5-foot radius, attack rolls against it have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}, and it can't benefit from the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition. Use d4s instead of the attack is ranged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|2-9|1d6} for each spell slot level above 2. Use d4s instead of the attack is ranged.

spell.name: Thunderous Smite

time.condition: which you take immediately after hitting a target with a weapon attack

entries: Your strike rings with thunder that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Thunder damage from the attack. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and have the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition. Use d4s instead if the weapon attack is ranged.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|1-9|1d6} for each spell slot level above 1. Use d4s instead if the weapon attack is ranged.

feat.name: Savage Attacker
entries: Whenever you hit a target with a Weapon and roll the max number on one of your weapon's damage dice, roll an additional die of that type and add it to the damage. The new die counts as one of your weapon's damage dice. This cannot happen more than a number of times equal to the ability modifier used to make the attack on a single attack.

feat.name: Weapon Initiate
entries: You learn the basics of martial combat:

items.name: Weapon Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in two weapons

items.name: Weapon Mastery
items.entry: Choose a class. Gain 2 Masteries from that class's mastery list. Whenever you gain a level you can swap one of these masteries with a different mastery from the same list.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Styled Fighter
entries: You learn a fighting style:

items.name: Fighting Style
items.entry: You gain a fighting style feat

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Sharpshooter
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Shrapnel
items.entry: When you make an attack with a ranged weapon against a creature that is behind cover and hit, deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Firing in Melee
items.entry: Being within reach of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your ranged Attack Rolls with Weapons.

items.name: Long Shots
items.entry: Attacking at Long Range doesn't impose Disadvantage on your ranged Attack Rolls with Weapons.

feat.name: Heavy Armor Master
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Damage Reduction
items.entry: While you're wearing Heavy Armor, reduce any damage dealt to you by weapon attacks by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

feat.name: Jumper
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Movement Speed
items.entry: You gain movement equal to half your movement speed whenever you take an action other than the magic action or the attack action.

items.name: Jumping
items.entry: Your max jump distance is doubled.

feat.name: Mind Breaker
entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Shatter Mind
items.entry: If you force a creature to make a saving throw to maintain concentration by damaging them with a weapon attack and they fail by 5 or more, the attack becomes a crit. If it was already a crit, then the next time you force them to make a saving throw to maintain concentration within the next minute they have disadvantage.

items.name: Guard Mind
items.entry: Before you make an intelligence, charisma or wisdom saving throw, you can choose to add your proficiency bonus to the roll. If you do and fail, you cannot use this again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Mage Slayer
entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Break Concentration
items.entry: Once per turn before a creature would succeed or fail on a saving throw to maintain concentration that you caused them to make, you can subtract your proficiency bonus from their saving throw.

items.name: Spellguard
items.entry: If someone you can touch would fail a saving throw against a spell, you can add twice your proficiency bonus potentially changing it into a success. Once you use this benefit, you can't use it again until you finish a Long or Short Rest.

feat.name: Spell Sniper
entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Shrapnel
items.entry: When you hit a creature that is behind cover with a spell attack, deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Casting in Melee
items.entry: Being within reach of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your Attack Rolls with Spells.

items.name: Increased Range
items.entry: When you cast a Spell that has a range of at least 10 feet and that requires you to make an Attack Roll, you can increase the Spell's range by 60 feet.

feat.name: Athlete
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Climb Speed
items.entry: You have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed

items.name: Hop Up
items.entry: When you are Prone, getting up only spends 5ft of movement

items.name: Jumping
items.entry: Once at any time you can add 5 times your proficiency bonus to your jump distance until the start of your next turn. You regain this ability on a short or long rest.

feat.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Ignore Loading
items.entry: You ignore the Loading property.

items.name: Firing in Melee
items.entry: Being within reach of an enemy doesn't impose Disadvantage on your Attack Rolls with crossbows, arbelests or hand crossbows.

items.name: Recoil
items.entry: Whenever you make an attack with a crossbow, arbelests or hand crossbow you are pushed 5ft in the opposite direction of the attack.

feat.name: Dual Flurry
entries: You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Flurry
items.entry: You can attack twice, instead of once, as part of the light property.

entries.name: Borrowed Masteries
entries.entry: Learn 3 masteries and choose a damage type for each. You can use these masteries on any weapon attack that makes an attack roll. When you do, for that attack you can change the weapon's damage type to the type that was chosen for that mastery and you gain tolerance to that damage type until the end of your next turn

entries.name: Repeatable
entries.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

items.name: Expertise
items.entry: Gain expertise in a skill offered by the class that granted you this feat. If you were proficient in that skill, gain proficiency in a skill of your choice.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in three weapons.

items.name: Weapon Mastery
items.entry: Choose a class. Gain 5 Masteries from that list. Whenever you take a long rest you canchange one of those masteries to a different mastery on the same list.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Elemental Adept
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Chosen Element
items.entry: When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

items.name: Elemental Affinity
items.entry: You gain immunity to the chosen damage type and you can change any damage you deal with spells to the chosen damage type.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once, but you must choose a different element each time for Chosen Element.

feat.name: Counterstriker
entries: You gain the following beneifits:

items.name: Patient
items.entry: You can set two triggers when you hold your action or bonus action.

items.name: Counter Damage
items.entry: If you reduce damage using an instaneous reaction, reduce by twice as much.

feat.name: Poisoner
entries: This feat is replaced by the Chemical Adept feat

feat.name: War Caster
entries: You gain the following benefits

items.name: Damage Reduction
items.entry: When you take damage from a weapon attack you can reduce the damage by an amount equal to the level of a spell you're concentrating on. If you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Opportunity Spell
items.entry: When a creature provokes an Opportunity Attack from you, you can use your Reaction to cast a Spell at the creature, rather than making an Opportunity Attack. The Spell must have a casting time of one Action and must target only that creature.

feat.name: Mad Mage
entries: You gain the following benefits

items.name: Spread Madness
items.entry: Whenever you fail a saving throw to maintain concentration, enemies within 5 ft of your must succeed on a constitution saving throw or take psychic damage equal to the level of the spell you're concentrating on plus your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Mad Magecraft
items.entry: Choose a number of spells you know equal to your proficiency bonus. For each of those spells, choose a damage type. Whenever you cast one of those spells, you can change its damage type to the chosen damage type. You can change one of the spells you chose (and its corresponding damage type) whenever you gain a level in the class that granted you this feat.

feat.name: Great Sage
entries: Your mind is fully attuned with your magic, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Deep Concentration
items.entry: Before you take damage you can choose to add your proficiency bonus to a saving throw to maintain concentration that you make as a result of that damage. If you do and fail, you cannot use this again until you finish a short rest.

items.name: Vast Memory
items.entry: Learn a number of level 1+ spells equal to your proficiency bonus. They must be spells you can already learn from your spellcasting features. You can replace one of the spells with a different one whenever you level up.

items.name: Large
items.entry: Your are one size larger and the weight of your body is multiplied by 4.

items.name: Small
items.entry: You are one size smaller and the weight of your body is divided by 4

items.name: Dart
items.entry: Once when you take the dash action you can increase your movement speed by 10 ft until the start of your next turn. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

items.name: Crowded
items.entry: You can occupy the space of other creatures (no more than one at a time).

feat.name: Crafter
entries: You are adept at crafting things and bargaining with merchants, granting you the following benefits:

items.name: Tool Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in an Artisan's Tool of your choice.

items.name: Slapdash
items.entry: When you make or help with a crafting check you can divide the time spent modifier by 2. If you do, you cannot do so again until after a short rest.

items.name: Recycle
