items.entry: When you fail a crafting check there is a 10% chance that your materials are not negatively affected.

feat.name: Musician
entries: You grant the following benefits

items.name: Instrument Training
items.entry: You gain proficiency in a Musical Instrument of your choice.

items.name: Inspiring Song
items.entry: As you finish a Long Rest or short rest, you can play a song on a Musical Instrument with which you have Tool Proficiency and give Inspiration to allies who hear the song and do not have any inspiration. The number of allies you can affect in this way equals your Proficiency Bonus.

feat.name: Archery
entries: Once when you would miss a ranged weapon attack roll you can add two to your attack roll. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Dueling
entries: When you're holding a Melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to the weapon's damage die.

feat.name: Bashing
entries: You can use a shield as a d6 bludgeoning weapon with the guard property. If you have training with the shield then you're proficient in it as a weapon. This does not allow you to draw or stow the shield when you would normally draw or stow a weapon. Gain a weapon mastery from any class that can be used with this weapon.

feat.name: Titan Grip
entries: When you would draw or stow a weapon you can instead add or remove the following effect from one of your hands: Weapons in this hand are treated as if they are being held by two hands. You cannot have this effect on both of your hands at the same time unless you take this fighting style again.

feat.name: Interception
entries: Once you can use the reaction of your shield without expending your reaction. It must be a reaction you haven't used this turn and you cannot use this reaction again this turn. You regain this ability after a long rest.

feat.name: Protection
entries: Bonuses to AC granted by shields you are holding also apply to dexterity saving throws.You can use the reaction of a shield when someone you can touch would fail a dexterity saving throw.

feat.name: Superior Technique
entries: You learn one maneuver of your choice from the fighter class. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice.)

You gain two Stratagem dice, which are d6 (this die is added to any Stratagem dice you have from another source). This die is used to fuel your maneuvers. A Superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended Superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Unarmed Fighting
entries: The weapon damage die of your unarmed strikes is a d6. When you make an unarmed strike, you can choose to make it with two of your free hands. If you do, it counts as a two handed attack and the weapon damage die is a d8.
At the start of each of your turns, you can deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage to one creature you're grappling or holding onto.

feat.name: Strongdraw
entries: You can use strength instead of dexterity for weapons that don't have the loading property. If you do, masteries still treat your attack rolls as dexterity attack rolls. Add 1 to your weapon damage die when you make an attack in this way.

feat.name: Titan Throw
entries: You can give a melee weapon the thrown property when you attack with it. Its range is 60/120 and you subtract 1 from its damage die if you throw it.

feat.name: Dexterous Fighting
entries: You can use dexterity for strength based weapons. Add 1 to your weapon damage die when you make an attack in this way.

feat.name: Courier
entries: Gain a swim speed and a climb speed equal to your movement speed. Increase your movement speed by 5 ft.

feat.name: Defense
entries: You have +1 ac while you are wearing medium or composite armor.

feat.name: Evasion
entries: You have +2 to dexterity saving throws while you are wearing light armor or no armor

feat.name: Impenetrable
entries: While you are wearing heavy armor you have tolerance to slashing and piercing damage. Additionally, your max jump distance is not halved.

feat.name: Thrown Weapon Fighting
entries: Add 30 ft to the close range of your thrown weapons (60 instead if it's also a ranged weapon). The long range becomes twice your close range (4 times instead if its also a ranged weapon).

feat.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: Once per turn when you hit with an attack roll using a light weapon you can add 4 to the weapons damage die.

feat.name: Dual Wielding
entries: When you would draw or stow a weapon you can instead apply or unapply the following effect to one of your hands: Weapons in this hand are treated as if they have the light property.

When you gain this fighting style, you choose whether you gain the following feature: You can only have the previous effect on one hand at a time. When you make an attack with a light weapon add 1 to the damage die.

feat.name: Patient Disciple
entries: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Clash
items.entry: If you make an attack roll with a versatile weapon against a target immediately when it would hit with an attack roll or would be hit by an attack roll, you can choose to clash. If your attack roll is higher than the opposing attack roll, then the opposing attack misses. Additionally, you can choose to make your attack miss the target.

items.name: Patience
items.entry: If you spend your reaction to use a held action, regain your expended reaction.

items.name: Tools
items.entry: Gain proficiency in two tools.

items.name: Ease of Use
items.entry: You can make an ability check with one of these tools without holding it as long as it is on your person.

items.name: Masteries
items.entry: Gain 2 masteries. Whenever you gain a level you can swap one of these masteries with a different mastery.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: Tools
items.entry: Gain proficiency in two tools that are not alliances.

items.name: Mechanical Focus
items.entry: You can use those tools as spell focuses.

items.name: Two Cantrips
items.entry: Learn two cantrips from a class of your choice. Your spellcasting ability for these cantrips is the spellcasting ability of that class. You can replace these cantrips whenever you gain a level.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: Extra Opportunity Attack
items.entry: You can attack twice, instead of once, when you make an opportunity attack.

items.name: Somatic Components
items.entry: You can perform the Somatic Components of a spell with a hand that is holding a shield.

items.name: Protect Concentration
items.entry: If you receive a bonus to your AC from your shield or cover against an effect and that effect causes you to make a saving throw to maintain concentration, add those AC bonuses to the saving throw.

feat.name: Dual Shielder
entries: You gain the following features.

items.name: Twin Shield
items.entry: You can benefit from up to two shields at the same time.

items.name: Weaponized Defenses
items.entry: While wielding a shield, you can use 1d6 as the damage die for your unarmed strikes and your opportunity attacks can be unarmed strikes even if you don't have an empty hand.

items.name: Dual Don
items.entry: You can don or doff two shields when you normally would don or doff one.

feat.name: Eldritch Adept
entries: You gain the following features.

items.name: Invocation
items.entry: You learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the warlock class. Your spellcasting ability for any spells granted by this invocation is the ability you increased with this feat. If the invocation has a prerequisite of any kind, you can choose that invocation only if you meet the prerequisite. If the prerequisite states that you must be atleast a level 2 warlock, ignore that requirement. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the invocation with another one from the warlock class.

items.name: Impenetrable
items.entry: When you use a reaction granted by a shield you can regain your expended reaction. If you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn. It must be a reaction you haven't used this turn and you cannot use it again this turn.

items.name: Swap
items.entry: When you would normally draw or stow a weapon, you can instead swap (stow then draw) one shield you're holding with another shield on your person.

items.name: Windstep
items.entry: Once you can jump without a surface to push off of as long as you are held aloft or have a reduced fall speed. You regain this ability at the start of your next turn.

items.name: Feather Fall
items.entry: You know the Feather Fall spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain this ability after a short rest.

items.name: Launch
items.entry: As a reaction to getting pushed or pulled you can double the distance that it pushes or pulls you.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items: You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Propel
items.entry: As a bonus action you can double your Fly, Glide or Hover speed until the end of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Crash Landing
items.entry: Once as a reaction before you take damage from falling you can reduce the damage by a number of d6s equal to half your level. You regain this ability after a short rest.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

feat.name: Mind Over Matter
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose the other option for ignore pain

items.name: Ignore Pain
items.entry: Choose one of the following:
Whenever you would make a constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, make a wisdom saving throw instead.
Use wisdom instead of constitution for maximum hit points and rolling hit dice.

items.name: Ignore Death
items.entry: Once as a bonus action you can ignore all of the negative effects of having zero or less hit points (including death saving throws) for 5 rounds which conclude at the start of your turn. Rounds where you do not spend any movement do not count towards the duration of the effect. You regain this ability after a long rest.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this one additional time, but if you do you must pick the other option for ignore pain.

feat.name: Lifesaver
feat.repeatableNote: Yes, but you must choose the other option for miraculous recovery

items.name: Emergency Attention
items.entry: Immediately before you take the help action to attempt to stabilize a creature you can halve the creature's negative hit points (The hit points must be less than zero). You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Miraculous Recovery
items.entry: For every healing die that rolls the highest number it can roll, add a die of that type. This only applies when you are healed or when you heal a creature other than you (choose when you gain this feat).

items.name: Hazardous Distraction
items.entry: As a reaction immediately before a creature you can see within a distance equal to a third of your movement speed is affected by a harmful area of effect you can move up to a third of your movement speed straight towards them. If you end your movement in the area of effect, you can make an opportunity attack with a melee weapon against them.

items.name: Avoid Hazard
items.entry: When you take the dodge action you can gain immunity to a damage type of your choice until the end of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Run Away
items.entry: When you use the Take Cover reaction you can move three times as far and until the end of the turn you can apply the bonus granted to you by cover to any saving throw you make.

items.name: Keep Safe
items.entry: When you take the dodge action until the end of your next turn creatures other than you that you can touch have advantage on dexterity saving throws and attack rolls against them have disadvantage.

items.name: Chosen Chemicals
items.entry: Choose Poison damage or Acid damage.

items.name: Adjust for Species
items.entry: Once at any time you can pick a creature type. Until the start of your next turn, damage you deal of the chosen type to creatures of the type you picked ignores resistance and immunity. Additionally, if any of the damage dice roll their highest value add an additional damage die. It is the same damage type and die type. Additional dice can be added in this way no more than a number of times equal to twice the ability modifier increased by this feat to each instance of damage. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses on a long rest.

items.name: Proficiency
items.entry: You gain proficiency in one tool of your choice.

items.name: Expertise
items.entry: Gain expertise in a tool offered by the class that granted you this feat. If you were proficient in that tool, gain proficiency in a tool of your choice.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: 1st-level feat
items.entry: Gain a first level feat.

items.name: Concealed Weapon
items.entry: Attacking with a light weapon does not reveal you from hiding.

items.name: Bleed
items.entry: Once when you hit with a light weapon you can make the target bleed. If you do, they take damage equal to your proficiency bonus at the end of each of their turns until they use their action to stop it. You regain this ability after a short rest.

items.name: Repeatable
items.entry: You can take this feat more than once.

items.name: Toss
items.entry: When you take the attack action you can spend one of its attacks to use a consumable that would normally take an action to use. If you do, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all uses after a long rest.

items.name: Fuse
items.entry: As an action you can attach a consumable to a surface. Choose a number of rounds up to a minute, concluding at the end of your turn. It must be a consumable that takes an action to use. When someone steps on the 5ft square of surface it's attached to or the fuse's duration has passed, the item is used. The effect is centered on the space adjacent to the surface it was attached to.

items.name: At the ready
items.entry: You can draw or stow a consumable that takes an action to use when you would normally draw or stow a weapon.
